page.title: 05Courteenhall House
page.content: The house built 1791 replaced the former Elizabethian House demolished in 1793. Humphrey Repton designed the new parkland and Samuel Saxon was engaged as architect. The House, a three storey cube built of local limestone with greyer Weldon Stone for the base is a good example of Regency architecture. The internal friezes and plasterwork are particularly fine. Usage of rooms remains the same although several small rooms on the ground floor have been modernised ie. kitchen, study. The outbuildings, originally kitchens & servants quarters have been converted to garages, offices & utility rooms. The Palladian Stables built 1760 have been converted into a family house.
